body.p: Usually when linking to resources outside the documentation, normal web links are used.
There are two aspects to take in consideration when styling them:

ul.li: When printed on paper, show the entire URL so that the user can see it and type it in a browser.
When displayed in a PDF reader, mark it as a link so that the user can click on it.

body.codeblock: This is a link to the W3C website.
body.p: To fulfill both conditions, you can add text after the "W3C" text, with the entire value of the href attribute, and use the link or -oxy-link property to mark the generated content as being a link:
